tilt

This is an overview of tilt’s software and data.

Most links are public but some are restricted to the members of the domain 2degrees-investing.org, the members of the GitHub organization 2DegreesInvesting, or specific people.

Navigating the code

How to find the most relevant repos

This website mentions a number of GitHub repositories (repos) under our GitHub organization. Search our repos at https://github.com/orgs/2DegreesInvesting/repositories.

Our GitHub organization has many repos. The most relevant ones use the prefix “tilt” (e.g. tiltIndicator) and the topic “tiltsmes”.

  • Search public repositories.
  • Search private repositories.

How to understand what each repo is about

Towards the top, each repo has an “About” seciton with useful information or links.

Scrolling down past the folders and files, each repo has at least a short description of its goal, and commonly also the sections “Installation” and “Example”.

Most repos also have a website (linked in “About”) with a function’s “Reference” and a “Changelog”.

How do repos or packages relate to each other

With few exceptions, each repository is structured as an R package. *Every package must have a DESCRIPTION. In fact, it’s the defining feature of a package*. If a package depends on another package, then that package dependency is listed under the fields Depends, Imports, Suggests, or Remotes.

Remotes lists packages that are not on CRAN, such as all of the packages in the tilt ecosystem. For example, this is the Remotes section of the DESCRIPTION file of tiltIndicatorAfter:

Remotes: 
    2DegreesInvesting/tiltIndicator,
    2degreesinvesting/tiltToyData,
    2DegreesInvesting/tiltAddCO2,
    2degreesinvesting/tiltTransitionRisk,
    2degreesinvesting/tiltPolish

This means that the package tiltIndicatorAfter depends on five other packages: tiltIndicator, tiltToyData, tiltAddCO2, tiltTransitionRisk, and tiltPolish. And they are all hosted on the GitHub organization 2DegreesInvesting.

Learn more in the book R Packages.

Highlights

The app

The tilt app is our most public-facing technical product. It helps users learn about the tilt project, and explore and request data. It’s built with R shiny, structured as an R package, and hosted on Google Cloud Run.

The tilt app depends directly on two repos:

  • tiltWebTool: Public software.
  • tiltWebToolData: Private data used in the app.

For information about the tilt app project including links to the app see https://bit.ly/tilt-app-info. For an overview about building and hosting the app see https://bit.ly/tilt-offboarding-videos.

Other related repos

The app’s data is generated via multiple other repositories. Here is how the most important ones relate to each other, starting from the one closest to the app, and moving towards the deeper layers of the tilt system architecture:

  • tiltOutput: Archive of the private data, with multiple versions and intermediate outputs.
  • tiltIndicatorAfter: Process indicator results so that they are closer to the user-facing outputs. This is an R package and depends on multiple other “tilt” packages. To discover each dependency see the Remotes section of its DESCRIPTION file.
  • tiltIndicator: Implement the core business logic of the tilt indicators.
  • tiltToyData: Toy datasets.
  • tiltIndicatorBefore: Create input datasets for the tilt ecosystem.
  • tiltData: Process company data and other data.
  • tiltEp: Get company data from the web.

How to update this website

This is a Quarto website. To update it, clone it’s repo from GitHub, do your changes, preview the results, render the site, push your changes to GitHub, and publish the updated site to GitHub Pages (video).
